data.title: Federal judges order Trump admin to continue funding SNAP during shutdown after USDA claims lack of authority. Program serves 1 in 8 Americans, costs $8B monthly.
data.description: Two federal judges issued orders on Friday demanding that President Donald Trump's administration restore funding for the Supplemental Nutrition Assistance Program (SNAP) amidst the current government shutdown. Judges John J. McConnell in Rhode Island and Indira Talwani in Massachusetts instructed the use of emergency reserves to sustain the program, which serves approximately one in eight Americans. The U.S. Department of Agriculture (USDA) had planned to cease SNAP payments starting November 1, citing a lack of funding authority. SNAP costs around $8 billion per month and is a vital component of the nation's social safety net. The rulings coincided and were prompted by the USDA's decision. Judge McConnell oversaw one of the cases.

data.title: Sizewell C nuclear project in Britain attracts investors despite initial obstacles, breaking ground now.
data.description: Construction has officially commenced on the project dubbed Sizewell C, after overcoming hesitant investors and local resistance.

data.title: Cointelegraph sees major traffic drop following Google algorithm adjustments, causing worry among crypto media outlets.
data.description: Cointelegraph has reported a notable decrease in website traffic following recent adjustments to Google's algorithm. This decline in traffic has stirred worry among the crypto media industry.

data.title: Tims China issues Senior Secured Convertible Notes & amends 2024 convertible notes, announced by TH International Limited.
data.description: On October 31, 2025, TH International Limited (Nasdaq: THCH), responsible for operating Tim Hortons in China, revealed a significant financial move. They have finalized a deal to issue Senior Secured Convertible Notes. Alongside this, the company disclosed modifications to their previous 2024 unsecured convertible notes. This decision marks a strategic step for THCH's financial strategy, aimed at making notable advancements in their operations.

data.title: OKX's reserves reach $35.4B after 36 months of Proof of Reserves. 75% annual growth sets industry standard.
data.description: OKX has recorded a 75% rise in reserves on an annual basis, reaching a total of $35.4 billion. This achievement comes as OKX completes 36 consecutive months of Proof of Reserves reporting, establishing a new industry benchmark for transparency and accountability.

data.title: Q3 2025 sees Riot Platforms revenue soar due to Bitcoin mining. The company ramps up data center operations.
data.description: In the third quarter of 2025, Riot Platforms, Inc. announced a substantial growth in revenue, predominantly attributed to their Bitcoin mining activities. This surge in revenue has prompted the company to disclose plans for extensive expansions within their data center operations.

data.title: Xi Jinping meets with Canadian, Thai, Japanese PMs at APEC. Head-of-state diplomacy crucial for advancing ties: expert.
data.description: On October 31, 2025, in Beijing, Chinese President Xi Jinping held meetings with the Prime Ministers of Canada, Thailand, and Japan during the 32nd APEC Economic Leaders' Meeting. According to the Xinhua News Agency, discussions were held with the leaders of Canada, Thailand, and Japan. From these countries, Thailand and Japan have both participated in various initiatives at the meeting, reflecting a growing relationship with China.

data.title: Economist Zandi says NY and CA could impact US recession, while other states struggle, potentially affecting nearly a third of US GDP.
data.description: Economist Mark Zandi from Moody's Analytics highlighted the crucial role of two states, New York and California, in determining whether the United States will face a recession. Zandi referred to them as "bellwethers" as their economic performance closely reflects the overall national trends. While recognizing that numerous states might already be in a recession, New York and California are described as "treading water," managing to remain stable amidst significant economic challenges. A concerning number of states are currently struggling, with some already in recession while others are on the brink. These states collectively contribute to nearly one-third of the U.S. GDP. Although the national economy has not yet reached that point, there is clear evidence of a gradual loss in momentum. For more details, Zandi's latest State of the States update provides an in-depth analysis.

data.title: XPENG delivers record 42,013 vehicles in October 2025, up 76% YoY, surpassing 40,000 deliveries for 2nd consecutive month.
data.description: A Chinese smart vehicle company, XPeng Inc., achieved a new milestone by delivering 42,013 vehicles in October 2025, marking a 76% year-on-year increase. This record-breaking figure surpassed 40,000 deliveries for the second consecutive month. XPeng's remarkable performance was announced on October 31, 2025, further solidifying its position as a key player in the automotive industry. The company is listed on the NYSE under the ticker symbol XPEV and on the HKEX as 9868.

data.title: MaxsMaking Inc. reports revenue of $12.40 million, up 27.43% YoY, with net income of $0.18 million in the first half of fiscal year 2025.
data.description: MaxsMaking Inc., a customized consumer goods manufacturer, reported unaudited financial results for the first half of the fiscal year ending April 30, 2025. Revenue was $12.40 million, a 27.43% increase from $9.73 million the previous year. Gross profit was $1.34 million, with a margin of 10.82%. Net income was $0.18 million, resulting in basic and diluted earnings per share of $0.02. The company highlighted a focus on domestic sales growth, expansion into new markets like Oceania and Africa, and increased R&D spending. Additionally, they completed an IPO, raising $6.5 million. Operating expenses rose to $1.17 million, and net cash provided by operating activities was $0.85 million. The Companyâ€™s A shares began trading on Nasdaq on July 7, 2025.

data.title: Former Louisiana Attorney General Charles C. Foti, Jr. launches probe into Hasbro, Inc. on October 26, 2023. - 100 characters
data.description: On October 31, 2025, Charles C. Foti, Jr., a former Attorney General of Louisiana and a partner at Kahn Swick & Foti, LLC (KSF), declared an investigation into Hasbro, Inc. (NasdaqGS: HAS). The investigation began on October 26, 2023.

data.title: CEO Amador emphasizes critical security needs in stablecoin industry due to rising vulnerabilities, posing serious risks.
data.description: Mitchell Amador, the CEO of Immunefi, emphasizes the pressing requirement for heightened security measures within the swiftly expanding stablecoin industry. He points out that vulnerabilities present significant risks that cannot be ignored.

data.title: Li Auto delivered 31,767 vehicles in Oct 2025, totaling 1,462,788 deliveries overall.
data.description: Beijing, China - Li Auto Inc., a prominent player in China's new energy vehicle sector, disclosed that it successfully delivered 31,767 vehicles in October 2025. This brings the total number of vehicles delivered by Li Auto to 1,462,788 as of October 31, 2025. The company is listed on Nasdaq under the ticker symbol LI and on the Hong Kong Stock Exchange as 2015.

data.title: White House restricts reporters' access to Press Secretary's Office, breaking tradition and adding to limits on media.
data.description: The decision marked a departure from longstanding traditions and contributed to the Trump administration's increasing restrictions on the press, further building on a series of measures taken against the media.

data.title: Xi Jinping proposes five-point plan for Asia-Pacific community at APEC, focusing on economic globalization.
data.description: On October 31, 2025, Chinese President Xi Jinping presented a five-point plan to enhance universal and inclusive economic globalization and establish an Asia-Pacific community. Xi's proposal aims to promote mutual benefits and inclusivity in global economy.

data.title: Jump Crypto exchanges $205M in Solana for Bitcoin, leading to a drop in SOL's price amid market fluctuations.
data.description: The exchange of $205 million worth of Solana into Bitcoin by Jump Crypto has led to a notable decrease in SOL's price, mirroring wider market patterns.

data.title: Bluesky Digital Assets shares corporate updates, releases corrective disclosure.
data.description: A recent report reveals that the unemployment rate in the United States has dropped to 4.2%, the lowest it has been in over 50 years. The country added 531,000 jobs in October, exceeding economists' expectations. This improvement in the job market has been attributed to the reopening of businesses and increasing consumer demand. The leisure and hospitality sector saw the most significant growth, adding 164,000 jobs. Additionally, average hourly earnings rose by 0.4% in October. These positive trends indicate a recovering economy and offer hope for many Americans during these challenging times.

data.title: 1.5M Angelenos still at risk despite judicial rulings. Urgent action needed for SNAP benefit suspension. CEO calls for solutions.
data.description: On October 31, 2025, Miguel Santana, the president and CEO of the California Community Foundation (CCF), emphasized the critical importance of addressing food insecurity as the possible suspension of SNAP benefits looms. Santana stressed the necessity for prompt relief measures and long-term solutions to combat this issue.

data.title: COMPUCHILD expands to Castro Valley and San Leandro, California with new franchisee, offering STEAM-focused education programs.
data.description: A new franchisee has recently joined the COMPUCHILD Children's Education franchise family based in DUBLIN, Calif. The announcement was made on October 31, 2025. COMPUCHILD is known for offering Entrepreneurial STEAMâ„¢-focused after-school education programs catering to children. This addition marks a significant expansion for the franchise, showcasing its commitment to providing quality education to children.

data.title: Philanthropist Patrick Carroll commits to Boys & Girls Clubs of Greater Tampa Bay with a substantial five-year investment.Total Amount: undisclosedDuration: 5 yearsFocus Area: Health & Wellness ProgramDate: Oct. 31, 2025
data.description: In Tampa Bay, Florida on October 31, 2025, Patrick Carroll, an entrepreneur and philanthropist, disclosed a significant pledge for the Boys & Girls Clubs of Greater Tampa Bay. The commitment spans five years and emphasizes bolstering the organization's Health & Wellness Program aimed at aiding youth mental health.
